clinical_study.brief_title: Transferrin Saturation Coefficient and Ferritinemia in Diagnosis of Iron Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Accordance Between Transferrin Saturation Coefficient and Ferritinemia in Diagnosis of Iron Deficiency, in Patients Hospitalised in Internal Medicine Service and 65 Years Old and More

brief_summary.textblock: Transferrin saturation coefficient and ferritinemia in diagnosis of iron deficiency

primary_outcome.measure: Agreement between Transferrin Saturation Coefficient (TSC) and ferritinemia dosage
primary_outcome.description: The overall agreement, assessed by kappa Cohen

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of iron deficiency with and without anaemia
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with iron deficiency with or without anaemia

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of etiologies of iron deficiency
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients for each etiology

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of iron deficiency in patients with anticoagulant and platelet aggregation inhibitor

arm_group.description: - Patients aged 65 and over hospitalized in the department of Internal Medicine and Geriatry

intervention.description: Each patient will follow a blood test in order to compare between ferritinemia and transferrin saturation coefficient in iron deficiency diagnosis

study_pop.textblock: Elderly people hospitalized in the internal medicine and geriatry service

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥ 65 years old
- Patient hospitalized in the internal medicine and geriatry service
- Patient affiliated with a social security scheme
- Patient signed an Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Risk benefit balance not in favor of iron deficiency check-up
- Patient in palliative care

overall_official.affiliation: Groupement des Hôpitaux de l'Institut Catholique de Lille
